candidates.title: v0.8: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
- crossbeam-channel 0.5.8 -> 0.5.9
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.61. (#1037)
- crossbeam-deque 0.8.3 -> 0.8.4
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.61. (#1037)
- crossbeam-epoch 0.9.15 -> 0.9.16
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.61. (#1037)
  - Improve support for targets without atomic CAS. (#1037)
  - Remove build script. (#1037)
  - Remove dependency on `scopeguard`. (#1045)
  - Update `loom` dependency to 0.7.
- crossbeam-queue 0.3.8 -> 0.3.9
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.61. (#1037)
  - Improve support for targets without atomic CAS. (#1037)
  - Remove build script. (#1037)
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.16 -> 0.8.17
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.61. (#1037)
  - Improve support for targets without atomic CAS or 64-bit atomic. (#1037)
  - Always implement `{,Ref}UnwindSafe` for AtomicCell. (#1045)
  - Improve compatibility with Miri, TSan, and loom. (#995, #1003)
  - Improve compatibility with unstable `oom=panic`. (#1045)
  - Improve implementation of `CachePadded`. (#1014, #1025)
  - Update `loom` dependency to 0.7.

Closes https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/issues/1048

skiplist is in the master branch, so I'll release it in another PR.

candidates.title: Update flume requirement from 0.10 to 0.11
candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [flume](https://github.com/zesterer/flume) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from flume's changelog.

[0.11.0] - 2023-08-16

Added

  • WeakSender, a sender that doesn't keep the channel open
  • Sender/Receiver::sender_count/receiver_count, a way to query the number of senders and receivers attached to a channel
  • Sender/Receiver::same_channel, a way to determine whether senders and receivers are attached to the same channel

Changed

  • Relaxed some API features
  • Make all remaining spinlocks opt-in

Fixed

  • Fixed a rare race condition in the async implementation

[0.10.14] - 2022-07-21

Fixed

  • Fixed unbounded memory usage in RecvFut::poll_inner

[0.10.13] - 2022-06-10

Added

  • SendSink::sender, to get the sender of a SendSink

[0.10.12] - 2022-03-10

Changed

  • Updated nanorand to 0.7

[0.10.11] - 2022-02-14

Fixed

  • Out-of-order bug when using channels asynchronously

[0.10.10] - 2022-01-11

Added

  • From<SendError> and From<RecvError> impls for other error types
  • Marked futures as #[must_use]

Changes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

candidates.title: Various cleanups
candidates.body:
I'm putting them into one PR because CI is slow. See individual commits for content.

- AtomicCell: Always implement {,Ref}UnwindSafe.
- Use 2021 edition & v2 resolver 
- Use [lints] in Cargo.toml & apply more lint
- Alternative to #724 & remove dependency on scopeguard

Closes #724

candidates.title: Bump MSRV to Rust 1.61, various cleanups
candidates.body:
Originally, I intended to just raise the MSRV to unblock the #1015 and #1033, but the parts of #1015's change that do not affect the behavior, and the implementation of #1033 are now included...

Closes #1033

candidates.title: v0.8: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
- crossbeam-epoch 0.9.14 -> 0.9.15
  - Update `memoffset` to 0.9. (#981)
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.15 -> 0.8.16
  - Improve implementation of `CachePadded`. (#967)

Closes #986

candidates.title: epoch: bump `memoffset` to v0.9
candidates.body: CC: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/111839

candidates.title: v0.8: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
- crossbeam-channel 0.5.7 -> 0.5.8
  - Fix race condition in unbounded channel. (#972)

Also, yanking `>= 0.5.1, <= 0.5.7` that affected by the bug fixed in this release.

candidates.title: v0.8: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
Changes:
- crossbeam-channel 0.5.6 -> 0.5.7
  - Improve handling of very large timeout. (#953)
- crossbeam-deque 0.8.2 -> 0.8.3
  - Add `Stealer::{steal_batch_with_limit, steal_batch_with_limit_and_pop}` methods. (#903)
  - Add `Injector::{steal_batch_with_limit, steal_batch_with_limit_and_pop}` methods. (#903)
- crossbeam-epoch 0.9.13 -> 0.9.14
  - Update `memoffset` to 0.8. (#955)
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.14 -> 0.8.15
  - Add `#[clippy::has_significant_drop]` to `ShardedLock{Read,Write}Guard`. (#958)
  - Improve handling of very large timeout. (#953)
  - Soft-deprecate `thread::scope()` in favor of the more efficient `std::thread::scope` that stabilized on Rust 1.63. (#954)

Backports:
- https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/903
- https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/936
- https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/953
- https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/954
- https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/955
- https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/958

candidates.title: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
- crossbeam-skiplist 0.1.1
  - Fix `get_unchecked` panic by raw pointer calculation. (#940)

Also, I'll yank crossbeam-skiplist 0.1.0 once 0.1.1 is released.

candidates.title: v0.8: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
Backports #932

Changes:
- crossbeam-epoch 0.9.13
  - Fix build script bug introduced in 0.9.12. (#932)
- crossbeam-queue 0.3.8
  - Fix build script bug introduced in 0.3.7. (#932)
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.14
  - Fix build script bug introduced in 0.8.13. (#932)

candidates.title: v0.8: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
Backports #922 and #926.

Changes:
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.12 -> 0.8.13
  - Update `memoffset` to 0.7. (#926)
  - Improve support for custom targets. (#922)
- crossbeam-queue 0.3.6 -> 0.3.7
  - Improve support for custom targets. (#922)
- crossbeam-epoch 0.9.11 -> 0.9.12
  - Improve support for custom targets. (#922)

Closes #928

candidates.title: crossbeam-epoch: Bump memoffset to 0.7
candidates.body: mostly to keep the number of dupes of crates in my dependency graph down

candidates.title: 0.8: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
Backports #913 and CI-related patches.

Changes:
- crossbeam-epoch 0.9.10 -> 0.9.11
  - Removes the dependency on the `once_cell` crate to restore the MSRV. (#913)
  - Work around [rust-lang#98302](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/98302), which causes compile error on windows-gnu when LTO is enabled. (#913)
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.11 -> 0.8.12
  - Removes the dependency on the `once_cell` crate to restore the MSRV. (#913)
  - Work around [rust-lang#98302](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/98302), which causes compile error on windows-gnu when LTO is enabled. (#913)

candidates.title: Remove dependency on once_cell and work around windows-gnu LTO issue
candidates.body:
Replace `once_cell` with our own `OnceLock` that based on unstable `std::sync::OnceLock` due to MSRV issue[^1].

This also fixes #856 due to windows-gnu LTO issue.

[^1]: [The current readme says crossbeam support at least 6 months old compilers](https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/blob/e54f01e7a7e3913407e817ce3e578a76b6392ef1/README.md#compatibility), but that is a minimum guarantee and is [actually more conservative](https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/877#issuecomment-1192585582).

candidates.title: Update crossbeam-channel benchmarks
candidates.body:
Changes:
- updated dependencies
- updated README instructions and results
- removed `chan` benchmarks because `chan` is unmaintained since 2018
- added `flume` to the plot; I tried to include other libraries as well, but that makes graphs overlap:
![plot_example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54238857/189514011-7796b2f4-f88c-418c-82ee-ea47f109bea3.png)

candidates.title: Miri: Fix thread leak in WaitGroup doctest
candidates.body: https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/runs/7849290051?check_suite_focus=true

candidates.title: Update patch to once_cell
candidates.body: https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/runs/7595350691?check_suite_focus=true

candidates.title: Initial release of crossbeam-skiplist
candidates.body:
Now that all the TODOs in #635 have been resolved, I think we can release the initial version.
There are still some open issues in #635, but I don't think they are blockers of the 0.1 release.

(There are some breaking changes in the master branch, but skiplist is not affected.)

Closes #635

candidates.title: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
- crossbeam-channel 0.5.5 -> 0.5.6
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.38. (#877)
- crossbeam-deque 0.8.1 -> 0.8.2
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.38. (#877)
- crossbeam-epoch 0.9.9 -> 0.9.10
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.38. (#877)
  - Mitigate the risk of segmentation faults in buggy downstream implementations. (#879)
  - Add `{Atomic, Shared}::try_into_owned` (#701)
- crossbeam-queue 0.3.5 -> 0.3.6
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.38. (#877)
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.10 -> 0.8.11
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.38. (#877)
- crossbeam 0.8.1 -> 0.8.2
  - Bump the minimum supported Rust version to 1.38. (#877)

candidates.title: Bump MSRV to Rust 1.38
candidates.body:
It was released [nearly 3 years ago](https://blog.rust-lang.org/2019/09/26/Rust-1.38.0.html) and meets our MSRV policy.

This allows using const_in_array_repeat_expressions (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/49147) and `<pointer>.cast()`.

candidates.title: Prepare for the next release
candidates.body:
- crossbeam-utils 0.8.9 -> 0.8.10
  - Fix unsoundness of `AtomicCell` on types containing niches. (#834)
    This fix contains breaking changes, but they are allowed because this is a soundness bug fix. See #834 for more.

chosen_pr.title: Update flume requirement from 0.10 to 0.11
chosen_pr.body:
Updates the requirements on [flume](https://github.com/zesterer/flume) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from flume's changelog.

[0.11.0] - 2023-08-16

Added

  • WeakSender, a sender that doesn't keep the channel open
  • Sender/Receiver::sender_count/receiver_count, a way to query the number of senders and receivers attached to a channel
  • Sender/Receiver::same_channel, a way to determine whether senders and receivers are attached to the same channel

Changed

  • Relaxed some API features
  • Make all remaining spinlocks opt-in

Fixed

  • Fixed a rare race condition in the async implementation

[0.10.14] - 2022-07-21

Fixed

  • Fixed unbounded memory usage in RecvFut::poll_inner

[0.10.13] - 2022-06-10

Added

  • SendSink::sender, to get the sender of a SendSink

[0.10.12] - 2022-03-10

Changed

  • Updated nanorand to 0.7

[0.10.11] - 2022-02-14

Fixed

  • Out-of-order bug when using channels asynchronously

[0.10.10] - 2022-01-11

Added

  • From<SendError> and From<RecvError> impls for other error types
  • Marked futures as #[must_use]

Changes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view
